subject: feat(import): add arc deduplication to merge service
body:
Previously, arcs were blindly accepted on every import — re-importing
the same data created duplicate connections every time. Now arcs go
through the same new/duplicate/conflict detection as nodes.

Arc matching: after node matching builds an ID remap (imported → existing),
arc endpoints are remapped and compared against existing arcs by
source+target+normalized title. Direction matters; reversed endpoints
are treated as distinct.

Changes:
- mergeService: MergeArcItem now has existingMatch, status, propertyDiffs.
  buildMergeProposal accepts existingArcs parameter. getApprovedItems
  preserves existing arc ID for accepted conflicts.
- countByStatus returns nested { nodes, arcs } counts.
- ImportModal: accepts and passes existingArcs prop.
- App.tsx: passes arcs to ImportModal.
- MergeReview: shows connection sections (new/duplicate/conflict) with
  human-readable "Source → Target (relationship)" labels, per-item
  toggle, and bulk accept/skip.

Tags: import, merge, arcs, deduplication
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 3
Impact: user-facing
Risk: medium
Debt: paid
Epic: import-compatibility
Semver: minor
